context: In 2024, Tyler Technologies led the global State and Local Government software market with an 11.2% share, effectively holding a near-monopoly on the public sector nationwide. Microsoft held the largest overall market share in global government software at 17.7%. Direct rivals in the state/local government space include Accela, CentralSquare Technologies, Granicus, OpenGov, NEOGOV, BS&A, Fast Enterprises, CivicPlus, Edmunds GovTech, and Euna Solutions. These competitors often focus on specific government functions such as permitting, licensing, or human capital management. Tyler's comprehensive suite of solutions positions it to address a broad range of government requirements, differentiating from more narrowly focused rivals.
